publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1434 Margaret Mitchell: Trans-bus Consortium Buy-Out-That the Parliament congratulates the consortium of Scottish business leaders for safeguarding 900 jobs in Camelon and Larbert by rescuing the Falkirk bus building firm, Alexander Dennis, from receivership and for securing a new contract worth £7.5 million to deliver 50 new double-decker buses and wishes the firm well in all its future negotiations, whilst noting that the rejuvenation of this firm is especially welcome against the background of a Scottish manufacturing slump.
S2M-1434 Trans-bus Consortium Buy-Out (lodged on 8 June 2004) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-1434 Margaret Mitchell: Trans-bus Consortium Buy-Out-That the Parliament congratulates the consortium of Scottish business leaders for safeguarding 900 jobs in Camelon and Larbert by rescuing the Falkirk bus building firm, Alexander Dennis, from receivership and for securing a new contract worth £7.5 million to deliver 50 new double-decker buses and wishes the firm well in all its future negotiations, whilst noting that the rejuvenation of this firm is especially welcome against the background of a Scottish manufacturing slump. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith
S2M-1434 Trans-bus Consortium Buy-Out (lodged on 8 June 2004) Donald Gorrie*
